subject: Sleep
title: Sleep in Ancient China
description: A quick win: understand Sleep in Ancient China.

hook.text: Ancient Chinese medicine considered sleep a balance between yin and yang. Insomnia meant your yin was deficient.

buildup.text: Traditional Chinese medicine prescribed specific sleep positions, directions, and herbal remedies for sleep problems.

discovery.text: Sleeping with your head pointing north was forbidden because north represented death and the afterlife.

twist.text: Chinese ceramic pillows were designed to stay cool and firm, believed to maintain clarity of mind during sleep.

climax.text: Many ancient Chinese sleep practices align with modern sleep science, like keeping cool and maintaining consistent timing.

punchline.text: Ancient Chinese sleep wisdom was science before there was science.

quiz.question: How did traditional Chinese medicine view insomnia?
options: As a yin deficiency in the body
